children.name: bend
children.definition: to make sth have acurvedshape, or to fold something at an angle, by pushing or pressing it:uốn
examples: Someone had bent the aerial.
He bent the wire into an ‘S’ shape.

children.name: bend sth back/down etc
examples: We had to bend the branches back so we could get through the bushes and back onto the path.

children.name: coil
children.definition: towindortwistinto around shape, or to wind or twist sth in this way:cuộn tròn lại, quấn tròn lại
examples: The snake had coiled itself in a corner of the cage.
The snake coiled around the branches of the tree.
He coiled the rope.

children.name: twist
children.definition: to bend and turn sthseveraltimes, such as a piece of wire, cloth, or rope, especially in order to tie it to sth or make sth with it:xoắn, cuộn , quấn
examples: Laura twisted the handkerchief in her hands nervously.
We twisted a wire coathanger and used it to open the car door.

children.name: twist sth into/around/through etc sth
examples: Her long blonde hair was twisted into a knot on the back of her head.
She twisted her handkerchief into a knot.

children.name: twist sth together
examples: Twist the two ends of the wire together.

children.name: bent
children.definition: sth that is bent has lost its original shape and is not flat or straight:cong
examples: ▪ The nail was bent.
▪ How did this spoon get bent?
▪ The hinge was bent and the lid wouldn’t shut properly.
▪ Stand with your legs slightly bent.

children.name: wavy
children.definition: /ˈweɪvi/ a line or edgethat is wavy hassmoothbends in it in aregularpattern:

children.name: gợn sóng, uốn lượn ( mềm mại )
examples: ▪ A series of wavy lines appeared on the video monitor.

children.name: Một loạt các đường gợn sóng hiện ra trên màn hình video
examples: ▪ The flag’s stripes are wavy and alternate in color.

children.name: Sọc lá cờ lượn sóng và xen kẽ nhau
curved
children.definition: /kɜːʳvd/  sth that is curved has a long, smooth bend in it, usually because it has been made that way:

children.name: cong ( mềm mại, thường là được làm như vậy )
examples: ▪ The knife had a heavy curved blade.

children.name: ▪ The temple’s roof is curved, in the Thai style
examples: ▪ An airplane wing is curved on top and flat on the bottom.

children.name: twisted
children.definition: /ˈtwɪstɪd, ˈtwɪstəd/  something that is twisted has been bent inmany directionsso that it has lost its original shape and may be impossible to recognize:

children.name: quăn queo ( bị uốn cong thành nhiều hướng )
examples: ▪ Pieces of twisted metal and rusted pipe lay scattered around the yard.

children.name: Nhiều mảnh kim loại xoắn và ống rỉ rải rác khắp sân
examples: ▪ Investigators sifted through the twisted wreckage of the plane.

children.name: Các nhà điều tra đã nhìn qua những đống đổ nát vặn vẹo của chiếc máy bay
warped
children.definition: /wɔːʳpt/  awoodenobjectthat is warped has bent and twisted because ofheatordryness, so that it isno longer flat or straight:

children.name: bị cong ( miếng gỗ phẳng, do bị tác động nhiệt, khô, tuổi thọ )
examples: ▪ The window frames on the front of the house were badly warped.

children.name: Các khung cửa sổ ở phía trước ngôi nhà bị bẻ cong
examples: ▪ An old man was sweeping the warped boards of the front porch.

children.name: Một ông lão đang quét những tấm ván bị bẻ cong ở phía trước nhà
crooked
children.definition: /ˈkrʊkɪd, ˈkrʊkəd/  something such asa line, row, pipe, or treethat is crooked is not straight but bendssharplyinoneormoreplaces :

children.name: cong queo, khúc khủy ( ở 1 hay nhiều điểm )
examples: ▪ Smoke rose out of the crooked chimney.
khói bay ra khỏi ống khỏi uốn cong.
▪ They moved down the narrow crooked streets of the old town.

children.name: Họ đi xuống những con đường cong nhỏ hẹp ở phố cổ
wiggly
children.definition: /ˈwɪgəli/  a wiggly line is one that has a lot of small curves in it :

children.name: ngoằn nghoèo , uốn éo, vặn vẹo, cong queo
examples: ▪ She wrote with large wiggly letters.

children.name: flexible
children.definition: sth that is flexible is able to bend easily or can be bent easily, especially because it has been made like this to do a particular job:mềm dẻo dễ uốn
examples: The better tennis racquets are made out of tough but extremely flexible graphite.
Designers have come up with a technique for making skis more flexible.

children.name: pliable
children.definition: able to bend withoutbreakingorcracking:mềm dẻo, dễ uốn
examples: High quality leather is firm yet pliable.
a shoe made of soft pliable leather
—pliability[U]

children.name: when a road, river etc bends
weave
children.definition: to turn and change direction, especially around things, in smooth curves: đi quanh co

children.name: weave through/up/across etc
examples: The river weaved across the plain, towards the sea.

children.name: weave its way
examples: The old highway weaved its way through Tucson.

children.name: bend
children.definition: /bend/  uống cong
examples: ▪ The road bends right then left, before passing a petrol station.
▪ At the top of the hill, the path bends sharply left and enters a small woodland.

children.name: curve
children.definition: if a road, track, coast etc curves, it has alongsmoothbend in it:uốn cong
examples: curve[C] B2 a place where there is a bend in theroad:chỗ cong
He lost control of the car on a sharp curve.
round a curve
I rounded the curve looking for a place to pull over.

children.name: curve away/round/towards etc
examples: The dusty white road curved away towards the mountains.
a sandy beach curving gently around the bay.
The road curves to the left as you go up the hill.

children.name: wind
children.definition: if a road, track, or river winds, it hasmanysmoothbends and is usuallyverylong:uốn khúc quanh co
examples: winding[attri] B2 a winding road, river etc islongand hasa lot of bendsin it: quanh co, ngoằn ngoèo
The car climbed the winding road up into the hills.
a quiet little town on the banks of a peaceful, winding river.

children.name: wind through/along/around etc
examples: The trail winds through the hills and then down towards Ironhorse Falls.
Route 101 winds along the coastline for several hundred miles.

children.name: wind its way
examples: We decided to take the Blueridge Parkway, which winds its way through the Smoky Mountains.

children.name: zigzag
children.definition: /ˈzɪgzæg/  if a road, track, or path zigzags it hasmanysharpbendsgoing inoppositedirections:khúc khủy ( với nhiều đường cong rất cứng nhắc)
examples: ▪ The path zigzagged from side to side through the steep gully.

children.name: ▪ ski routes zigzagging down the mountainside
twist
children.definition: if a track, road, or stream twists it has many sharp bends and changes direction many times: cong queo,quanh co, uốn khúc
examples: twist around/along/through etc:
The path twisted back and forth up the side of the mountain:
A dry stream bed twisted through thick tree roots.
twisting[attri]
Wild flowers grew on either side of the twisting path.

children.name: twist and turn
examples: The streets are narrow and twist and turn and it is not advisable to take a car up them.

children.name: twist its way
examples: We approached Assisi via the dusty road that twists its way up Monte Subasio.

children.name: tortuous
children.definition: a tortuous path, stream, road etchas a lot ofbendsin so that it is verydifficultto travel along:quanh co, hiểm trở ( do có nhiều khúc cua )
examples: ▪ Most of the villages are accessible only by boat or along tortuous jungle trails.

children.name: ▪ a twisting, tortuous track through the Snake Mountains
bend
children.definition: /bend/ uốn cong
examples: The branches of the tree bent over into the water.
I tried opening it with the knife but the blade bent.

children.name: curl
children.definition: if aleaforpieceofclothcurls, itgraduallybends, starting at its edges, especially as a result ofheatordryness:quăn , cuộn lại
examples: ▪ I threw the letter into the fire. It curled, darkened, and then burst into flames.

children.name: curl inwardcuộn lại vào trong
examples: ▪ The document was yellow and its edges had curled inward.

children.name: buckle
children.definition: /ˈbʌkəl/  if sthstrongandhardbuckles, it bends in the middle, usually because of very strongpressureorgreatheat:cong lại, co lại
examples: ▪ The aluminium chair buckled under Charles’s weight.
▪ Windows shattered with the heat from the blaze and metal doors buckled like cardboard.

children.name: warp
children.definition: if sth made ofwoodwarps, it bends and twists slightly as a result of too muchheat,dryness,ageetc, so that it isno longer flat or straight:cong, vênh
examples: The wooden fence had warped in the hot sun.
To prevent the violin body from warping, there is a strong wooden brace along its whole length.

children.name: stiff
children.definition: asubstancesuch asclothorpaperthat is stiff is hard and is difficult to bend: khô cứng
examples: The leaves of the plant are very stiff.
a stiff piece of cardboard.

children.name: frozen stiff
examples: In the extreme cold my wet shoes became frozen stiff.

children.name: rigid
children.definition: anobjectorstructurethat is rigid is strong and willnotbendorchangeitsshape:cứng
examples: The framework of the aircraft must be rigid yet light.
About a dozen large rigid plates make up the Earth’s crust.

children.name: bend
children.definition: a curved part of something, especially a road or river :
examples: The car came round the bend at a terrifying speed.
bend in
a sharp bend in the road

children.name: a sharp/tight bend
children.definition: a curve that changes direction suddenly
examples: That road sign means you are approaching a sharp bend.

children.name: a hairpin bend
children.definition: a very sharp bend in which a road changes direction, usually on a mountain
examples: The road wound up the mountain in a series of hairpin bends.

children.name: a slight/gentle/wide bend
children.definition: that changes direction slightly or gradually
examples: Ahead of us there was a wide bend in the river.

children.name: a blind bend
children.definition: that you cannot see around when you are driving
examples: Never overtake another car on a blind bend.

children.name: a left-hand/right-hand bend
children.definition: going towards the left or the right
examples: Take the turning just after the left-hand bend in the road.

children.name: come around/round the bend
examples: Suddenly a motorbike came around the bend at top speed.

children.name: round the bend
examples: He rounded the bend much too fast.

children.name: curve
children.definition: along smoothbend in a surface, line, or object:đường cong, khúc uốn cong
examples: From the balcony, you could see the long curve of the shoreline.
Morgan was killed when he lost control of his car in a curve.

children.name: a smooth curve
examples: He drew a line on the paper in a smooth curve.

children.name: a gentle curve
children.definition: one that turns gradually in another direction
examples: the river's gentle curves

children.name: a sharp/tight curve
children.definition: one that turns suddenly in another direction
examples: There's a tight curve in the road up ahead.

children.name: an upward/downward curve
examples: She stood watching the upward curve of the bird's flight.

children.name: a sweeping curve
children.definition: wide and gentle
examples: the sweeping curve of the bay

children.name: a graceful curve
examples: Her arm arched over her head in a graceful curve.

children.name: twist
children.definition: asuddensharpbend in sth: khúc cua, đoạn bẻ cong.
examples: The path has a lot of twists and turns.

children.name: kink
children.definition: asmallsharpbend in sth, especially something that isstraightfor the rest of its length:chỗ bị gập ( trên một đường thẳng dài )

children.name: kink in
examples: The water hose had a kink in it.
If there’s a kink in the hose, you won’t get any water.
There was a kink in the path just before the bridge.

children.name: arch
children.definition: to form or make sth form the shape of an arch
examples: Two rows of trees arched over the driveway.
Trees archoverthe river.
Her eyebrows arched in contempt.
She watched the cat arch itsback.
The dogarcheditsback.

children.name: round
children.definition: preposition,adverbmainly UK(US usuallyaround)AROUNDquanh, vòng quanh, loanh quanh; xung quanh, tròn

children.name: in a circular direction or position; around
examples: _The Moon goes round the Earth.
_We ran round (the outside of the house) to the back, looking for the dog.
_The idea has been going roundand roundin my head all day (= I can't stop thinking about it).
_When one engine stopped, we had toturnround (= turn to face the opposite direction) and fly home.

children.name: roll
children.definition: verbTURN OVERcuốn, quấn, cuộn
examples: [ T usually + adverb or preposition]
to (cause something to) turn over onto itself to form a cylinder or a sphere
_He rolled the clayintoa ball in his hands.
_As I got closer, the hedgehog rolled itself(up) intoa ball.

children.name: wind
children.definition: verbwound,woundWRAP AROUND

children.name: to wrap something around an object several times or twist it repeatedly around itself
examples: _She wound a scarfaroundher neck.
_He wound the stringintoa ball.
_He wound a small bandageroundher finger.
